metadata.title: CVE-2014-7850 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Web UI in FreeIPA 4.xbefore 4.1.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTMLvia vectors related to breadcrumb navigation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7850` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.1.4-1
freeipa-client - 4.1.4-1
freeipa-common - 4.1.4-1
freeipa-server - 4.1.4-1
freeipa-server-dns - 4.1.4-1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.1.4-1
freeipa-tests - 4.1.4-1
python-ipaclient - 4.1.4-1
python-ipalib - 4.1.4-1
python-ipaserver - 4.1.4-1
python-ipatests - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeipa package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
